div1.head: Abstract of Article on Yellow Fever, by Henry Rose Carter, [19--]
div1.p: Abstract of Article on Yellow Fever, by H. R. Carter.

The article on yellow fever in the Nelson Loose Leaf Medi-
cine is not intended to go exhaustively into the history: epidemio-
logy or pathology of that disease. It is, however, a fair and con-
sistent synopsis of its more important points, especially of those
most recently brought to light; keeping the perspective as well as
possible.

The sections on the clinical history: diagnosis: treatment and
post mortem appearances are short, but omit no essential details.

Those on etiology: epidemiology and prophylaxis are longer and
on these subjects the author goes more into detail: both on account
of their importance in modern sanitation and because the recent ad-
ditions to our knowledge have been almost exclusively along these
lines.

The article contains the essentials of Reed's work: so much of
the biology of the Stegomyia mosquito as is needed to understand the
prophylaxis of yellow fever: the essentials of this prophylaxis as
practiced by Gorgas and others and, what has not hitherto appeared
in book form, the essentials of Carter's doctrine of the elimination
of yellow fever by failure of the human host and of the work of Nogu-
chi with Leptospira icteroides.

The newly added leaves contain, among other things, the new fea-
tures of Connor's work (the elimination of yellow fever) in Guayaquil
and those for the present half year will contain the same for the Peru-
vian epidemic of 1920 under charge of the author. of the above men-
